intro: Pedicularis muscoides, commonly known as the musk orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish to reddish flowers. Its roots form symbiotic relationships with fungi, which help it absorb nutrients from the soil. This species is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments.
